title: More groups join suit over federal 'termination' of NYC congestion pricing
author: Josh Niland
byline: By Josh Niland Mar 5, '25 6:42 PM EST
excerpt: Two nonprofit organizations—the Riders Alliance and Sierra Club—have joined the Metropolitan Transportation Administration (MTA) in a legal effort to halt the federal government from withdrawing its past approval of congestion pricing in New York City. The groups filed to join the...
text: Two nonprofit organizations—the Riders Alliance and Sierra Club—have joined the Metropolitan Transportation Administration (MTA) in a legal effort to halt the federal government from withdrawing its past approval of congestion pricing in New York City. The groups filed to join the MTA’s lawsuit in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York as interveners. Earthjustice has more details on their attempt, which follows the Trump Administration’s revocation of the Department of Transportation’s support on February 19th.
html:
Two nonprofit organizations—the Riders Alliance and Sierra Club—have joined the Metropolitan Transportation Administration (MTA) in a legal effort to halt the federal government from withdrawing its past approval of congestion pricing in New York City. 

The groups filed to join the MTA’s lawsuit in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York as interveners. Earthjustice has more details on their attempt, which follows the Trump Administration’s revocation of the Department of Transportation’s support on February 19th.
